item.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18681)
item.content:encoded:
abolishicedenver - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=abolishicedenver&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pauder
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit ‚Äî several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19 people near the US-Mexico border ‚Äî including after the unit had been flagged for human rights violations by US officials, Mexican civilians and a prominent Mexican politician.

On January 22, authorities discovered the 19 bodies ‚Äî shot and killed and burned beyond recognition ‚Äî in a charred pickup truck in the municipality of Camargo, near ...the Texas border. Authorities have identified 16 of the victims through DNA analysis. Of these, 14 were Guatemalan migrants traveling to the United States. The other two were Mexican nationals.

On February 8, the Attorney General‚Äôs Office in Tamaulipas announced there was sufficient evidence against 12 members of the Tamaulipas special operations group known as the Grupo de Operaciones Especiales (GOPES) to charge them for the massacre.

The newly-formed GOPES unit was already under scrutiny for human rights abuses in the weeks before the migrant killings. On January 6, a group of at least 25 families in Ciudad M√≠er accused GOPES officers of having ‚Äúattacked, robbed and intimidated‚Äù their community. As many as four people were allegedly disappeared and tortured by members of the force.

On January 13, Mexican congresswoman Olga Juliana Elizondo urged the Tamaulipas State Attorney General‚Äôs Office and the Secretary of Public Security to ‚Äúinvestigate and, where appropriate, sanction the human rights violations committed by the GOPES.‚Äù

Yet as recently as 2020, GOPES officers received training from US authorities, according to GOPES commander F√©lix Arturo Rodr√≠guez Rodr√≠guez, who was quoted in multiple news reports. The US agency that provided the training and how it took place remains unclear, but the unit‚Äôs officers had a history of training with US law enforcement."

En Espa√±ol

https://elpais.com/‚Ä¶/la-masacre-de-tamaulipas-el-sueno-amer‚Ä¶

See MoreThe United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit -- several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19

insightcrime.org

The United States, a Special Operations Unit and a Massacre in Mexico

The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit -- several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19The United States provided training to a troubled Mexican police unit -- several of whose members were charged in a January massacre of 19

item.title: Detainees report of no running water or heat.
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Detainees report of no running water or heat.

Reports are emerging from ICE detention centers of solitary confinement cells with no heat and guards blasting fans at detainees complaining of cold.

theintercept.com

‚ÄúDying of Cold‚Äù: ICE Detainees Freezing in Southern Prisons

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverUnicorn Riot was live.Unicorn Riot is reporting from northern Minnesota where indigenous water protectors and their allies...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverUnicorn Riot was live.

Unicorn Riot is reporting from northern Minnesota where indigenous water protectors and their allies are taking action against construction of the Enbridge Line... 3 tar sands oil pipeline. The controversial pipeline has garnered mass opposition due to the threats it poses both the the global climate and local ecosystems and waterways.

More info on recent resistance against Line 3: https://unicornriot.ninja/‚Ä¶/lockdown-to-keep-it-in-the-gro‚Ä¶/

If you appreciate this coverage, please consider a tax-deductible donation so that we may continue to cover similar stories: https://unicornriot.ninja/donate

Unless otherwise noted, all Unicorn Riot media is published under Creative Commons' NC-BY-SA 3.0 US license

See More

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "Enbridge is currently constructing a 300+ mile expansion...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Enbridge is currently constructing a 300+ mile expansion to their filthy Line 3 tar sands pipeline through pristine lands and 200+ water bodies in northern Minnesota, including the headwaters of the Mississippi River. This new project, the largest in Enbridge‚Äôs history, illegally cuts through unceded Anishinaabe treaty territory, violating indigenous rights to hunt, fish, and gather wild rice and medicine on their ancestral federally-recognized lands. Like all terrible thin...gs in this world, Line 3 is being funded by large financial institutions -- some of which happen to have offices right here in Denver. On March 31st, 18 banks will decide whether or not to renew a $2.2 billion loan to Enbridge.

Join us this Friday, February 19th, in a noise demonstration outside the offices of some of the major bankrollers of Enbridge's illegal Line 3 expansion. We will gather at Pulaski Park (Bayaud & Steele) at 8:30am, then head over to the Cherry Creek shopping district and pay a visit to some of these nasty corporations.

‚óè Please wear a mask and practice social distancing.

‚óè Please try to show up by 8:30am. We will be leaving the park at 9am and we will need some time to go over legal questions and get informed consent from all people participating in the event.

‚óè Bring your friends! Bring pots and pans! Bring whatever you've got to make some noise and let these financial institutions know that the people demand they immediately divest from Line 3 and stop supporting cultural genocide and environmental terrorism.

‚óè Make signs/art. We will be protesting in front of banks with BIG windows. It is a great opportunity to send a clear visual message and calling out the banks responsible for climate chaos."

Visit this website for a full list of banks funding Line 3:

https://www.ran.org/wp-
content/uploads/2020/12/RAN-Briefing_Line3_KXL.pdf

#DefundLine3 #StopTheMoneyPipeline #StopLine3 #KeepItInTheGround #WaterProtectors #BankingOnClimateChange #WildRice #HonorTheTreaties #FossilBanksNoThanks #IndigenousRights

See More

FRI, FEB 19

Defund Line 3 Noise Demo

Pulaski Park28 people interested

item.title: Via Mijente We know the Biden immigration bill will have...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Via Mijente

We know the Biden immigration bill will have language on border control tech & a "virtual wall."

Our report with American Friends Service Committee & Transnational Institute shows why we're concerned. The Democrats get big money from border firms. We can't allow a virtual wall instead of a physical one. Both will be deadly for immigrants. Read our latest research: tni.org/en/bidensborder

...

No te pierdas nuestro informe con Transnational Institute, TNI American Friends Service Committee ‚ÄìLa frontera de Biden, en el que examinamos a 13 de las principales empresas de la industria de seguridad de fronteras y su poder e influencia en ambos partidos pol√≠ticos de Estados Unidos:

https://t.co/yMIh5Bhi2h?amp=1

See MoreTransnational Institute, TNI

In 2020, Joe Biden received three times more donations than Donald Trump from the border security industry. Our new research with Mijente and American Friends S...ervice Committee looks into the deep ties of money and influence between the leading border security contractors and the Democratic Party - and shows why challenging this border-industrial complex will be critical if the US is to truly end racist hostility against migrants.

item.title: "After a period of clearing migrant children from their...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"After a period of clearing migrant children from their facility, Devereaux Behavioral Health in Westminster is quietly building up staffing for their ORR migrant children program. This is an organization that has been sued countless times for physical, emotional, and sexual abuse of children and which has been kicked out of several states because of their record of human rights abuses.

They are here in Colorado and need to be stopped."

Before the summer of 2018, most Americans had never heard of the Flores settlement or about the Office of Refugee Resettlement (ORR) and its role in the care and placement of unaccompanied immigrant minors. Once it became known that the Trump administration was separating families at the border and....
